channel.title: DUCTF2023 on chrootcommit
channel.description: Recent content in DUCTF2023 on chrootcommit

item.title: DUCTF2023 Web Actually_Proxed
item.description: Team: XxxPassword123xxX Difficulty: easy Code analysis Secret server’s code : package main import ( "flag" "fmt" "log" "net/http" "os" "strings" ) var ( port = flag.Int("port", 8081, "port to listen on") ) func main() { flag.Parse() http.HandleFunc("/", func(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) { xff := r.Header.Values("X-Forwarded-For") ip := strings.Split(r.RemoteAddr, ":")[0] if xff != nil { ips := strings.Split(xff[len(xff)-1], ", ") ip = ips[len(ips)-1] ip = strings.TrimSpace(ip) } // 1337 hax0rz 0nly! if ip !

item.title: DUCTF2023 Web Static_File_Server
item.description: Team: XxxPassword123xxX Difficulty: easy Code analysis from aiohttp import web async def index(request): return web.Response(body=''' <header><h1>static file server</h1></header> Here are some files: <ul> <li><img src="/files/ductf.png"></img></li> <li><a href="/files/not_the_flag.txt">not the flag</a></li> </ul> ''', content_type='text/html', status=200) app = web.Application() app.add_routes([ web.get('/', index), # this is handled by https://github.com/aio-libs/aiohttp/blob/v3.8.5/aiohttp/web_urldispatcher.py#L654-L690 web.static('/files', './files', follow_symlinks=True) ]) web.run_app(app) According to the code, the route /files gives access to static files. It maybe vulnerable to path traversal, let’s exploit it throught BurpSuite :

item.title: DUCTF2023 Web Proxed
item.description: Team: XxxPassword123xxX Difficulty: easy Code analysis package main import ( "flag" "fmt" "log" "net/http" "os" "strings" ) var ( port = flag.Int("port", 8081, "The port to listen on") ) func main() { flag.Parse() http.HandleFunc("/", func(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) { xff := r.Header.Values("X-Forwarded-For") ip := strings.Split(r.RemoteAddr, ":")[0] if xff != nil { ips := strings.Split(xff[len(xff)-1], ", ") ip = ips[len(ips)-1] ip = strings.TrimSpace(ip) } if ip != "31.33.33.7" { message := fmt.
